definitions.definition: A portal of entry into a building, room, or vehicle, consisting of a rigid plane movable on a hinge. Doors are frequently made of wood or metal. May have a handle to help open and close, a latch to hold the door closed and a lock that ensures the door cannot be opened without the key.
definitions.example: I knocked on the vice president's door

definitions.definition: Any flap, etc. that opens like a door.
definitions.example: the 24 doors in an Advent calendar

definitions.definition: A means of approach or access.
definitions.example: Learning is the door to wisdom.
Keep a door on your anger.

definitions.definition: A software mechanism by which a user can interact with a program running remotely on a bulletin board system. See BBS door.
To cause a collision by opening the door of a vehicle in front of an oncoming cyclist or pedestrian.
